Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: STATUS IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the well status.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: END TIME: Clock time that this status ended.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: PERCENT CAPABILITY: The working capability, compared to the maximum possibleexpected. This will enable the capture of a measurement representing the operationalcapacity associated with the status. Percent Capacity is normally calculated at thewell site or facility based on equipment manufacturer specifications, well operationsparameters, etc.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: START TIME: The clock time that this status came into effect.
Column Comment.11: WELL STATUS: This reference table defines the status of the well. For example:cased, spudded, licensed, dry, abandoned oil, gas, ...
Column Comment.12: STATUS DATE: Date the well status was reported.
Column Comment.13: STATUS DEPTH: Depth at which the well status is relevant
Column Comment.14: STATUS DEPTH OUOM: Status depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.15: WELL STATUS QUALIFIER This column contains the valid type of well statusqualifiers defined by the well status workgrouphttp://www.ppdm.org/standards/wellstatus. For example, in the well status facetFLUID TYPE, valid qualifiers are ABUNDENCE and COMPONENT FLUID DETAIL.
Column Comment.16: WELL STATUS QUALIFIER VALUE: This column contains the valid values for eachof the well status qualifiers defined by the well status workgrouphttp://www.ppdm.org/standards/wellstatus. This column should only be used to storethe values for qualifiers, and not for well status values themselves. For example, inthe well status facet FLUID TYPE, a valid qualifier is ABUNDENCE (goes inSTATUS_QUALIFIER). This column will capture the values PRIMARY,SECONDARY, SHOW and TRACE.
Column Comment.17: WELL STATUS TYPE: The type of status reported for the well. Can includeconstruction status, operating status, producing status, abandonment status etc.
Column Comment.18: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
